3rd-displacement, lightning bolt (DC 15), protection from energy

sections.body: During Combat The eldritch knight casts shield and displacement on herself, then casts lightning bolt and magic missile before casting mirror image and entering melee.
sections.name: Tactics

sections.body: A lone, lightly armored traveler carrying a walking staff, a queen of staves mixes spell power with whirling quarterstaff attacks.

sections.url: pfsrd://NPC Codex/Rules/Prestige Class NPCs/Eldritch Knight/Eldritch Knights/Queen of Staves/Esmerelda Darkshadow

sections.body: Those who think all elves are creatures of light and joy have not met Esmerelda. Dressing in dark colors with a temperament to match, Esmerelda believes she is doomed to a life of pain and gloom. Only when her enemies lie broken at her feet does she crack the slightest hint of a smile. Yet this dour disposition is not simply part of her nature—as a young woman, Esmerelda was told by an oracle that she would bring ruin and destruction to everything she ever loved. Two days later, her wife-to-be was slain by orcs. Resolved to never love again, she paints herself gray with ash to symbolize the death she carries.
Esmerelda travels the world alone, attacking those who trigger her mercurial temper (such as by not keeping their distance). Any sort of romantic proposition or prophecy magic sends her into a rage.
All Esmerelda can talk about is the ultimate futility of life and the inevitability of death and decay.

sections.name: Esmerelda Darkshadow

special_qualities: arcane bond (+1 quarterstaff), diverse training, elven magic, protective ward (2 rounds, +2 deflection, 5/day), weapon familiarity
name: Queen of Staves
skills: Knowledge (arcana) +10, Knowledge (local, nobility, planes, religion) +6, Perception +11, Ride +7, Sense Motive +5, Spellcraft +12 (+14 to identify magic item properties), Stealth +8
combat_gear: potion of cure serious wounds, scroll of displacement, scrolls of false life (2), wand of invisibility (20 charges)
